intro: Willoughbya argyreiae, commonly known as the velvetleaf. This plant is a member of the Malvaceae family and is native to Australia. It is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves that are covered in a dense layer of fine, silky hairs. The flowers are small and yellow, typically appearing in clusters. Willoughbya argyreiae is often found in wetland areas and is adapted to thrive in moist, swampy environments.
